column4: !register > HorizonXP    (HorizonXP, see the private message from ubotu)
register me too please :p
/msg ubotu register
: ty
: i have re-installation problem with Ubuntu can u assist me please ? :/

: Your session only lasted less than 10 seconds. If you have not logged out yourself, this could mean that there is some installation problem or that you may be out of disk space. Try logging in with one of the failsafe sessions to see if you can fix this problem.
are you out of disk space?
: baba i installed Ubuntu 6.10 n updated the files it needed reboot n then i rebooted it
: it gave me that Error
how are you talking to me now?  Can I give you commands to try on the Ubuntu computer?
: baba my English is sux n i am newbie on Linux :(
: sorry to bother you but im lookin for help for 3 days already
: can i PM u please ?
join me in #ubuntu-classroom

: oh well. i dl/ed Alternate Ubuntu 6.10 burnt a CD. booted my computer with that CD choosed first selection from the list. everything went fine. n then it wanted to me reboot computer without cd n then i did. n then i saw those things "Ubuntu 6.10 ubuntu tty1 -- Ubuntu login : "
ok, can you login?
what is the result of this command:  apt-cache policy ubuntu-desktop | grep -i Installed
k, try that now, and tell us the output
: slm baba "-bash : apt : command not found" :(
what is the result of this command:  apt-cache policy ubuntu-desktop | grep -i Installed               Did you forget the "-" after "apt"?
: i did " apt-cache policy ubuntu-desktop | grep -i installed " as you said, nothing showed up
every time I ask you to do something in ubuntu, do you have to reboot your computer to get into ubuntu?
alright, join me in #ubuntu-classroom
